titles.title: Captive Wildlife Safety Technical Amendment Act of 2005
Captive Wildlife Safety Technical Amendment Act of 2005
Captive Wildlife Safety Technical Amendment Act of 2005
A bill to amend the Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 to protect captive wildlife and make technical corrections.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe under authority of the order of the Senate of 07/29/2005 with amendments. With written report No. 109-126.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 197.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Unanimous Consent.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries and Oceans.

bill.summary: 9/9/2005--Passed Senate amended. Captive Wildlife Safety Technical Amendment Act of 2005 - Makes technical and conforming amendments to the Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 and the Captive Wildlife Safety Act relating to the enforcement of criminal penalties for captive wildlife offenses.
